I'm going (or playing) through inequality world in Natural Number Game right now and I wondered if there is a way to introduce a known theorem as a hypothesis

in particular I want to introduce a hypothesis that says "s \le succ(s)" (which we know is true) to use with transitivity.
Not sure this is introduced at this point, but something like have h := le_succ s
it's not inroduced at that point but I think I will use that anyways.
Leonard Borg has marked this topic as resolved.
Yeah I wonder if have should be introduced earlier. I have enough insights into the questions to know ways to solve them without using have, but a lot of people seem to find it useful.
i did solve it without it now but it wasn't very pretty. And given both le_trans and le_antisymm want two inputs generating a hypothesis feels quite useful at that point.
Take a look at the source code on GitHub to see how I did it :-)
